relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments
Campus officers are very active, watchful of any criminal activity. There haven't been any casualties since my arrival, when in need of help there are school patrols ready to serve you!
I have joined the PSi Chi organization and was given the opportunity to run in office as vice president.
There are many foreign clubs for foreigners that are new to the city. There is the french club and other international clubs. There are great organization for activism.
There are always activities for the students to become involved in. There are films and events throughout the academic year for all students such as the film festival and bands.
The food is a bit expensive but I have never had to complain about the quality. There is a variety of food ranging from the local fast food restaurants to chinese.
From close references, the dorms are not expensive and are relatively close to campus.
The school work assigned in classes are challenging but there are great professor who will make the material very understandable.
Students should get to become very fond of their professors and join organizations. By being active with their education, these opportunities will help them develop skills for their degrees.

The faculty and staff are very resourceful fulfilling any needs. The campus is continuing to grow, with new departments such as the engineering building for those seeking a degree in this field. I believe this is an excellent school for anyone especially those from across the boarder to attend.
pageTitle: The University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck UTEP isn't incredibly expensive. I haven't had a problem covering the expenses. I had a grant for 1000 and a loan, and I was covered. The Food Courts are expensive to me, though. I prefer eating out of campus. There's some cool restaurants around UTEP. Am enjoying being here Campus life is packed with activities. There are many clubs and events to go to, so it's hard to be bored. Since the community of students isn't that huge, you will be able to meet and connect to many people. I'm a music major, and I've met sooo many students who are majoring in music. There's also a good range of ethnicity here, so you'll meet lots of different people. It's fun that way. Whatever your major is, you'll most likely meet many of those who have the same major as you, and those who don't. Even if El Paso is a small town, there's always something to do, even if it's hanging out at a cool coffee shop, checking out downtown, cheering for the Miners at the Sun Bowl, or going to a concert. :) Am learning a lot For the time that I've spent here (2 semesters), every professor that I've had has a different
